Pre-Game Insights: The inaugural match of the series will be held at Hobart’s Bellerive Oval, followed by the second T20 match at Adelaide Oval on February 11. The series will conclude with the third T20 match at Perth Stadium on February 13.
Fans will be elated to see David Warner back in action after he decided to quit international cricket in Test as well as ODI format.

Historically, the Bellerive track has provided early movement for bowlers. However, as the match progresses, the field tends to become a batting paradise, largely due to the afternoon sea winds originating from the Derwent River. Hence, it will be a brilliant battle between bat and ball. One can expect a high scoring encounter.
Australia and West Indies have played 19 T20 matches against each other. Australia has won 9 matches, while West Indies has won 10 matches.
